alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Harlan, northeastern Bell and south central Leslie Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, weather radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tacky Town, or 9 miles west of Harlan, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bledsoe around 505 PM EDT. Wallins Creek, Coldiron and Black Snake around 510 PM EDT. Loyall, Tremont and Pathfork around 515 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kentenia, White Star, Sunshine, Baxter, Harlan, Teetersville, Elcomb, Tway, Harlan Gas, Clovertown, Kitts, Golden Ash, Liggett, Mary Alice, Grays Knob, Chevrolet, Martins Fork, Hensley Store, Lenarve, Peepace Store, Martins Fork Lake, Three Point and Bobs Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
